sen.j: 東大路通（ひがしおおじどおり）は京都市の主要な南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Higashioji-dori Street is one of the major north-south running streets in Kyoto City.
Higashioji-dori Street is one of the major north-south streets in Kyoto City.
Higashioji-dori Street is one of the major north-south streets in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 平安京の東の端、東京極大路であった寺町通に代わり、現在の市街地東端の南北幹線と認識される。
sen.e: It is now recognized as the north-south arterial street forming the eastern border of the current downtown, replacing the Teramachi Street that was once called Higasikyogoku-oji Street as the eastern end of Heiankyo.

It is now recognized as the north-south arterial street forming the eastern border of the current downtown, replacing Teramachi Street (once called Higasikyogoku-oji Street) as the eastern end of Heiankyo.

It is now recognized as the north-south arterial street that forms the eastern border of the current downtown, replacing Teramachi-dori Street (once called Higasikyogoku-oji Street) as the eastern end of Heiankyo.

sen.j: 東山通（ひがしやまどおり）という呼び方もされ、交差点名、バス停留所名などには市電時代からの「東山○○」が用いられる。
sen.e: The Higashioji-dori Street is also known as the Higashiyama-dori Street, so its crossings and bus stops were given the names starting with “Higashiyama,” following the practice of the days when Kyoto City Trams ran on the street.

Higashioji-dori Street is also known as Higashiyama-dori Street, so its crossings and bus stops were given names starting with “Higashiyama,” following the practice of the days when Kyoto City trams ran on the street.

Higashioji-dori Street is also known as Higashiyama-dori Street, so its crossings and bus stops were given names starting with 'Higashiyama,' following the practice of the days when Kyoto City trams ran on the street.

sen.j: なお京都市内には、東大路通以外に、大路の名のつくものに北大路通、西大路通、葛野大路通などの幹線道路があるが、いずれも近代以降に設けられたもので、明治以前には存在しなかった。
sen.e: Alos, beside Higashioji-dori Street, Kyoto City has other arterial streets having “oji” in their names, such as Kitaoji-dori Street, Nishioji-dori Street, and Kadonoji-dori Street, but any of them did not exist until the Meiji era and were built in the modern age or later.

Also, beside Higashioji-dori Street, Kyoto City has other arterial streets having “oji” in their names, such as Kitaoji-dori Street, Nishioji-dori Street and Kadonoji-dori Street; however, none of them existed until the Meiji era but were built in the modern age or later.

Also, beside Higashioji-dori Street, Kyoto City has other arterial roads having "oji" in their names, such as Kitaoji-dori Street, Nishioji-dori Street and Kadonoji-dori Street; however, they didn't exist until the Meiji period but were built in the modern age or later.
sen.cmt: 原文に『』のない" "を削除"era" -> "period" に変更しました。

sen.j: 北は北山通、南は線形 (路線)して九条通となる東福寺までである。
sen.e: In the north, the street ends at the Kitayama-dori Street; in the south it goes to Tofuku-ji Temple, where it is connnected with the Kujo-dori Street in alignment.
In the north, the street ends at Kitayama-dori Street; in the south it goes to Tofuku-ji Temple, where it aligns and connects with Kujo-dori Street.
In the north, the street ends at Kitayama-dori Street; in the south it goes to Tofuku-ji Temple, where it aligns and connects with Kujo-dori Street.

sen.j: 北大路通との交差点である高野から南へ東福寺までは京都市電の東山線が走っていた。
sen.e: From Takano, the crossing with the Kitaoji-dori Street to Tofuku-ji Temple, the Higasshiyama Line of Kyoto City Trams once ran northward.
From Takano, the crossing with Kitaoji-dori Street to Tofuku-ji Temple, the Higashiyama Line of Kyoto City trams once ran northward.
From Takano, the crossing with Kitaoji-dori Street to Tofuku-ji Temple, the Higashiyama Line of Kyoto City trams once ran southward.

sen.j: 市電の通っていなかった高野から北、北山通の間は道幅が狭くなる。
sen.e: In the north from Takano to the Kitayama-dori Street, where the tram did not run, the street is narrower.
In the north from Takano to Kitayama-dori Street, where the tram didn't run, the street is narrower.
In the north from Takano to Kitayama-dori Street, where the tram didn't run, the street is narrower.

sen.j: 京都市内の幹線道路にしては珍しく、祇園から五条坂にかけてはかなりアップダウンがある。
sen.e: Unlike other arterial streets in Kyoto City, the Higashiodori Street has many ups nad downs around an area from Gion to Gojozaka..
Unlike other arterial streets in Kyoto City, Higashiodori Street has many ups and downs around the area from Gion to Gojozaka..
Unlike other arterial streets in Kyoto City, Higashioji-dori Street has many ups and downs around the area from Gion to Gojozaka..

sen.j: 清水道・祇園を中心として、観光シーズンにはかなりの渋滞が発生する。
sen.e: In tourist seasons, heavy traffic jams occur in particular around Kiyomizu-michi and Gion.
Heavy traffic congestion occurs during tourist seasons, particularly around Kiyomizu-michi and Gion.
Heavy traffic congestion occurs during tourist seasons, particularly around Kiyomizu-michi and Gion.

sen.j: 京都駅と主要観光地を結ぶ路線バスの主経路にもなっているが、渋滞のために遅れを生ずることがしばしばである。
sen.e: Although the street is a major route for buses connecting Kyoto Station and major tourist spots, traffic congestions often cause the buses to delay, even
Although the street is a major route for buses connecting Kyoto Station and major tourist spots, traffic congestion often causes even the buses to be delayed.
Although the street is a major route for buses connecting Kyoto Station and major tourist spots, traffic congestion often causes even the buses to be delayed.

sen.j: ここ数年、秋の観光シーズンには、その渋滞軽減のための取り組みが行われている。
sen.e: For the past several years, measures have been taken to reduce the congestions in autumn tourist seasons.
For the past several years, measures have been taken to reduce congestion during the autumn tourist season.
For the past several years, measures have been taken to reduce congestion during the autumn tourist season.

sen.j: 上側が北側、下側が南側。
sen.e: North is upper and south is lower.
North is upper, and south is lower.
North is upper, and south is lower.

sen.j: 左側が西側、右側が東側。
sen.e: West is left and east is right.
West is to the left, and east is to the right.
West is to the left, and east is to the right.

sen.j: 交差する道路の特記がないものは市町村道。
sen.e: Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise specified.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise specified.
